content.description: This is a unique line climbing the prow like edge of Blank Slate that overlooks the streambed. Surmounting the lower overhang requires fun moves using pockets, compression, or both. The cruxy sit down start is a little awkward and might not be worth the effort for some...in that case a higher start with the RH on a sloper could be done which might lower the difficulty a grade.
content.location: The line is obvious-SDS below the overhang using a good incut for the RH and a flat sidepull for the LH. Climb up and just a little left (to avoid the loose rock on the right side) into the groove above the overhang. Itâ€™s possible to escape to the left at about 2/3 height onto the slab but for full value climb straight up over the steepest part of the upper face.

content.description: This is a big slab of rock standing upright in the bottom of the streambed. It offers a nice tall slab and the arete-like prow overlooking the streambed provides one of the better problems in the canyon. The only complaint is the proliferation of trees around the boulder which compromise the available climbing somewhat.
